quote: And before you answer this next question, let me remind you that you swore [pulls out a giant Bible] ON A BIBLE to tell the truth here today. [throws it away] So, tell us [points above] AND GOD, where the song 'Lovely Lovely' came from? HE'D like to know.
12 Jurors. 1 Judge. 1/2 a chance
Nobody believes kids!
Nobody believes nuns!
Take a seat.
How 'bout we start with your name?
Oh my God, am I supposed to be prosecuting?
A cute, fuzzy little bear. [smiles at jury] The defense rests.
When I was in junior high school, we did a trust fall at a ropes course and dropped the first girl. And then everyone started laughing because she was fat.
Step off, Holmes!
I'll take the case.
There was never a piano there.
Gimme the French Stuff.
Money. Money. I'll get the money!
Am I supposed to... err... um... in this?

Our Founding Fathers... guaranteed us certain protections. The freedom of speech, freedom of religion, the freedom to own and play stringed instruments of all kinds. Those Founding Fathers didn't place restrictions on these freedoms. They didn't say, 'The right to play guitar shall not be violated, except when used to play Green Day's, 'Time of Your Life,' over and over again in the common area of your dorm!' *No!* Where will these restrictions end? A background check when you want to take up banjo? A five day waiting period to buy a Telecaster? An all-out ban on the Flying V or, dare I say, whammy bar? Ladies and gentlemen of the jury, it is up to *you* to defend our right to keep and bear guitars.
Mr Gator ... [Wally Gator breaths menacengly, Harvey steps back], tell the court in your own words what you do each day
Objection, he isn't even wearing any pants.
I am no longer in control of my mind, and my wings are missing too.
Peanut, if we're going to win this case, I need proof.
What thing? Tell me. WHAT IS IT?!
So, we'll...we'll just go to the judge and tell him your story.
I have to call this number to find out if I have to report for jury duty (looks around, sees he is alone) Wait, who am I talking to?
